text:
Hi guys, excuse my ignorance if this has been answered before, but has anyone successfully done a WordPress to HubSpot blog Export before?
I've just done a test run with a draft blog and it brought all the content across except the featured image
I've followed this doc to do the test run: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-blog/import-your-wordpress-blog-posts-into-your-HubSpot-blog>
Also, when I finally do a full export, will it display blog posts in the same order as the WordPress site, ie. will it set the correct publish date rather than all exported blogs being the same publish date?

Hey <@U9MAWTESW>, the featured image is a pretty common issue, as WordPress does not include featured images when you do a regular post export. If you have just one blog to export, I've seen success with this if you export "all content" from WordPress. This export will include the featured images (which will upload them to your HS file manager), and the HS blog importer does an okay job of detecting the featured images. Do this on a test blog in HS if you don't want to mess up the blog you're importing the posts to.
Regarding publish date, if you keep the publish status during import, then the publish date will be maintained on all your posts.
Really great advice, thanks James :thumbsup:
No prob, best of luck with it

I detail out a really simple example of what the importer is expecting at the bottom of the README here: <https://github.com/williamspiro/hubXml>

As James noted, often the Wordpress exports do not contains the featured images in them, or they are not actually tied to the post `<item>` in any way
anyone know why Google Analytics is still being added to my site, when I've turned it off
check the header and footer html areas in content staging as well as your templates head and footer html areas
I’ve seen marketers place google analytics code in all of em
I've checked, see nothing. but its specifically says `<!--  Added by GoogleAnalytics integration -->`
Stupid question.. did you click save?
Haha yes
did you cachebuster it?
Did ALL the cachebusting
Is anyone else having issues adding custom modules to flex columns within the page editor? For some reason, I can only do it through the edit modules sidebar and can't drag anything to add it

stupid question #2 did you look in the page editor for that page and see if it was added to the head html area there? (would be a weird place for it, but again I’ve seen everything when it comes to marketers plopping tracking codes)
not :eye:
Checked nothing. Although, if a marketer added it to 30+ pages like that, I probably would just quit for the day
Just gonna open a ticket
ahh
one more thought, the domain picker under content settings, did you check that specific domain and not just the default
the specific domain can have . different settings than the default which affects all
My hero
I forgot about that
Thank you!
:spider::man:  the original :spider_web: developer #hero
(nor i)  if my random emoji was not clear
I run into this *allll the time.*
I’m not really sure what causes it or if HS is aware.
Yes, me! It was driving me nuts last night and this morning. I figured maybe I have too much stuff on my portal or something.
cc. <@U8THBCFC4>
hi! We're rolling out a partially rebuilt version of the sidebar that _should_ fix this. If you DM me your Hub IDs, I can ungate you!
slacked my HubID. Glad I wasn't the only one, thought I was going crazy and needed to update something
Woot woot! <@U8THBCFC4> is like a real-life HubSpot super hero :raised_hands::skin-tone-3::raised_hands::skin-tone-3: Thanks for helping these folks
:wink:
